item.title: [Error] (61:1): Identifier expected
item.dc:creator: @Arkanor Arkanor
item.description:
@Arkanor wrote:

It would sort of look like this (off the top of my head):

[code]program Whatever;
var
x,y:integer;
bitmapname1,bitmapname2:integer;

procedure bmps;
//bitmap string pasted here
//bitmap string pasted here
end;

begin
bmps;
repeat
repeat
if(findcolor(x,y,color,x1,y1,x2,y2))then
Clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(20);
until(findbitmapin(bitmapname1,x,y,x1,y1,x2,y2));
writeln(‘Dropped a ball.’);
until(findbitmapin(bitmapname2,x,y,x1,y1,x2,y2));
writeln(‘Game Over’);
end.[/code]

item.title: [Error] (61:1): Identifier expected
item.dc:creator: @Arkanor Arkanor
item.description:
@Arkanor wrote:

In the main loop, both he and your corrections have the same thing four times. It’s unnecessary.

And iruleatants, as Shadow pointed out, it’s cool if you lift some of my code as long as you give me credit for it. Claiming you wrote it entirely yourself is a laugh - you declared the variables with the exact same names that I used, used the same ballselect procedure, and declared the variable ‘ball’ even though it was never used in your script. At least you DID try and code the main loop on your own - that’s good. Be aware though that there are three different Zurroballs each game - you either need to introduce manual color picking with constants, or use an automatic color getter.

Read full topic

item.title: [Error] (61:1): Identifier expected
item.dc:creator: @inferno inferno
item.description:
@inferno wrote:

[quote=“ShadowSyntax, post:4, topic:1143”]1.)If you want it to repeat more than one thing then you have to add in begin and end; around the stuff you want it to repeat.

repeat begin the one thing you want it to repeat end; until(something happens);

2.)Also with the if statements if you are trying to make it repeat more than one thing you have to add in begin and end; around the stuff you want it to do.
e.g.
if(santa>yourmum)then
begin
pulloutshotgun;
end;[/quote]

1.) you don’t need to put begin and end in, it repeats everything in between the repeat and until.

2.)That point is correct but you’ve only put one command in the example. Should be something like:
if(santa>yourmum)then
begin
pulloutshotgun;
ShootHisFoot;
end;

Read full topic

item.title: [Error] (61:1): Identifier expected
item.dc:creator: @ShadowSyntax ShadowSyntax
item.description:
@ShadowSyntax wrote:

Working Version:

[code]////////////////////////////////////////////////
// ZurroBall v1.1 //
// Created by iruleatants //
////////////////////////////////////////////////

program Zurroball;

const
balltype=3; //what ball are you using? 1 is zurro, 2 is snot, 3 metal, 4 energy, 5 eye.

var
x,y,ball,time:integer;

procedure ballselect;
begin
if(balltype=1)then
begin
clickmouse(305,195,true);
time:=25;
end;

 if(balltype=2)then
 begin
      clickmouse(327,272,true);
      time:=15;
 end;
 
 if(balltype=3)then
 begin
      clickmouse(328,303,true);
      time:=2;
 end;
 
 if(balltype=4)then
 begin
      clickmouse(329,336,true);
      time:=5;
 end;
 
 if(balltype=5)then
 begin
      clickmouse(329,364,true);
      time:=10;
 end;

end;

begin
ballselect;
wait(1000);
repeat
begin
if(findcolor(x,y,8690073,188,18,300,104))then
begin
movemouse(x+random(5),y+random(5));
clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(time);
end;

      if(findcolor(x,y,9211020,188,18,300,104))then
      begin
           movemouse(x+random(5),y+random(5));
           clickmouse(x,y,true);
           wait(time);
      end;
      
      if(findcolor(x,y,9013657,188,18,300,104))then
      begin
           movemouse(x+random(5),y+random(5));
           clickmouse(x,y,true);
           wait(time);
      end;
      
      if(findcolor(x,y,9013657,188,18,300,104))then
      begin
           movemouse(x+random(5),y+random(5));
           clickmouse(x,y,true);
           wait(time);
      end;
      
 end;
 until(false);

end.[/code]

There were quite a few things wrong with the script.
The repeat statements were all messed up.

If you just want the script to repeat one thing:

repeat the one thing you want it to repeat until(something happens);

If you want it to repeat more than one thing then you have to add in begin and end; around the stuff you want it to repeat.

repeat begin the one thing you want it to repeat end; until(something happens);

You can replace the something happens with a check to compare variables (y>z), to wait for a boolean to be set to true, or to the word false if you want it to never stop repeating until the script has been terminated.

Also with the if statements if you are trying to make it repeat more than one thing you have to add in begin and end; around the stuff you want it to do.
e.g.
if(santa>yourmum)then
begin
pulloutshotgun;
end;

By the way, your script doesn’t use the variable ball so to make the script that little bit faster its a good idea to remove it.

And if that really is a bit of Arkanor’s script I’m sure its ok to edit it as long as you put that the original script was made by him in the credits.

//////////////////////////////////////////////// // ZurroBall v1.1 // // Originally Created by Arkanor // // Modified by iruleatants // ////////////////////////////////////////////////

And if your planning to release a modified script to the public then its generally a good idea to ask the original scripter first so they don’t get pissy

Read full topic

item.title: [Error] (61:1): Identifier expected
item.dc:creator: @Arkanor Arkanor
item.description:
@Arkanor wrote:

This looks like it’s my script with new coords and a totally effed up main loop.

Your main loop is… well, it’s bad. You copied the same thing four times, and never closed your loop. That’s what the identifier bit is - you’re missing the until(whatever) bit to close the loop.

Try coding your OWN script next time, instead of ripping mine.

Read full topic

item.description:

[code]////////////////////////////////////////////////

// Created by iruleatants //

time:=25;

time:=2;

time:=5;

[Error] (61:1): Identifier expected
